name: Caminho Português@pt
Camino Portugués@es
Portuguese Way@en
description: The Caminho Português (Camino Portuguese) covers the Camino routes starting in Portugal, usually Lisbon or Porto. Short pilgrimages usually start in Tui in Spain, It is the second-most popular route, after the French route. Variants include the side-pilgrimage to Fátima, the coastal route and the Spiritual Variant.

description.text: Capital city of Portugal and the start of the Portuguese Camino
The start point for the Portuguese Camino@en
notes: You can obtain a pilgrim's credential from inside the cathedral.@en

name: Catedral Basílica de Santiago de Compostela@ga

image.title: View from the Praza do Obradoiro

description.summary: The entrance point to the cathedral for those travelling the Portuguese Camino.@en
description.text: The entrance point to the cathedral for those travelling the Portuguese Camino. The entrance way has the traditional alpha-omega signs inverted, indicating that this is the end of your journey and the start of a new life.

legs.description: Via Rua da Fonte de Cerejeira (rough surface)

routes.name: Caminho Português
routes.description: The main Camino route starting in Lisbon and following the inland route

routes.name: Fátima - Tomar
routes.description: A variant pilgrimage including the Fátima shrine and returning to the main route at Tomar

routes.name: Fátima - Ansião
routes.description: A variant pilgrimage including the Fátima shrine and returning to the main route near Ansião

routes.name: Variante Espiritual
routes.description: The Spiritual Variant of the main route that follows the last part of the journey of the remains of the Apostle St.James. The variant ends with a boat trip up the Río Ulla

routes.name: Coastal Route
routes.description: An alternative to the central route from Porto, the coastal route follows the Atlantic coast from Porto into Spain

routes.name: Littoral Route
routes.description: A variation on the coastal route that follows the coastline from Porto to Vila do Conde

routes.name: Coastal - Central (Vila do Conde)
routes.description: A transfer from the coastal route to the central route from Vila do Conde to São Pedro do Rates.

routes.name: Central - Coastal (São Pedro de Rates - Fão)
routes.description: A transfer from the central route to the coastal route from São Pedro de Rates to Fão.

routes.name: Coastal - Central (Minho)
routes.description: A transfer from the coastal route to the central route from Carminha to Valença do Minho, traveling along the Minho river bordering Portugal and Spain.

routes.name: Coastal - Central (Minho by Boat)
routes.description: A transfer from the coastal route to the central route from Carminha to Valença do Minho, Via Camino by Boat along the Minho river

route-logic.name: Changes for the Littoral Route variation on the Coastal Route

route-logic.description: Re-introduce the small segment of the central route if we're going coastal-central-coastal
